channel.title: Posts on Website of Joseph Blazick
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on Website of Joseph Blazick

item.title: Dirichlet Processes
item.description: Extending to Infinite Components After working with mixture models, itâ€™s natural to wonder how one should best determine the correct number of components to include in our models.

item.title: Extending K-Component GMM to the Bivariate Case
item.description: Introduction In my previous post, we extended our Gibbs Sampler to handle any number of \(K\) Components and fit our model in the case where \(K=4\).

item.title: Extending GMM Gibbs Sampling to K-Components
item.description: Introduction In my previous post, I derived a Gibbs Sampler for a univariate Gaussian Mixture Model (GMM). In this post I will extend the sampler to handle the K-Component univariate GMM.

item.title: Gibbs Sampling for Mixutre of Normals
item.description: Gibbs Sampling Gibbs sampling is a Markov Chain Monte Carlo method for sampling from a posterior distribution usually defined as \(p(\theta|data)\).
